author: jochembrouwer
content: CC <@425269142615097345> this likely has to do with the JWT report ^

author: pk910
content:
sure that it's jwt related?  if the jwt file couldn't be read for either grandine or ethereumjs, it'd affect all pairs with that client?
they're all set up the same way, but it only affects one pair

author: jochembrouwer
content: It has to do with decoding messages, something to do with padding

author: jochembrouwer
content: Or well, thats what the report says

author: holgerd77
content:
Yeah, I would then think it's still not fully clear if it's more of an EthereumJS or a Grandine thing? So just for context, this is this issue:
https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/issues/3508

author: jochembrouwer
content: I can reproduce this locally and it has to do with JWT decoding it seems
